intro: Dianella javanica, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand and parts of Australia. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and spike-like inflorescence. The plant produces small, white or greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered at the tips of its stems. Dianella javanica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its fibrous leaves have historically been used by Māori for making clothing and other crafts.
